bug.author: daw3rd
bug.summary: Kmeans applyTo() creates a threadpool that is not shutdown()?
bug.description:
<denchmark-code>`public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
List<Point> pointList = new ArrayList<Point>();
double power[] = new double[1000]; Point p = new Point("myid","mylabel", power); pointList.add(p);
KMeansClustering kMeans = KMeansClustering.setup(15, 10, "euclidean"); ClusterSet clusterSet = kMeans.applyTo(pointList);
}` </denchmark-code>
results a the JVM not exiting. Examination of the threads shows what looks like a ThreadPool not being shutdown. Output is... SLF4J: Class path contains multiple SLF4J bindings. SLF4J: Found binding in [jar:file:/C:/Users/IBM_ADMIN/.m2/repository/org/slf4j/slf4j-log4j12/1.7.10/slf4j-log4j12-1.7.10.jar!/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class] SLF4J: Found binding in [jar:file:/C:/Users/IBM_ADMIN/.m2/repository/ch/qos/logback/logback-classic/1.1.2/logback-classic-1.1.2.jar!/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class] SLF4J: See <denchmark-link:http://www.slf4j.org/codes.html#multiple_bindings>http://www.slf4j.org/codes.html#multiple_bindings</denchmark-link> for an explanation. SLF4J: Actual binding is of type [org.slf4j.impl.Log4jLoggerFactory] Apr 07, 2016 3:23:35 PM com.github.fommil.netlib.BLAS WARNING: Failed to load implementation from: com.github.fommil.netlib.NativeSystemBLAS Apr 07, 2016 3:23:35 PM com.github.fommil.jni.JniLoader liberalLoad INFO: successfully loaded C:\Users\IBM_AD~1\AppData\Local\Temp\jniloader1572471182986630698netlib-native_ref-win-i686.dll <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
WARNING: COULD NOT LOAD NATIVE SYSTEM BLAS ND4J performance WILL be reduced Please install native BLAS library such as OpenBLAS or IntelMKL See <denchmark-link:http://nd4j.org/getstarted.html#open>http://nd4j.org/getstarted.html#open</denchmark-link> for further details <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
log4j:WARN No appenders could be found for logger (org.reflections.Reflections). log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly. log4j:WARN See <denchmark-link:http://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/faq.html#noconfig>http://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/faq.html#noconfig</denchmark-link> for more info. Dependencies are <denchmark-code> <dependency> <groupId>org.deeplearning4j</groupId> <artifactId>deeplearning4j-core</artifactId> <version>0.4-rc3.8</version> </dependency>
<dependency> <groupId>org.nd4j</groupId> <artifactId>nd4j-x86</artifactId> <version>0.4-rc3.8</version> </dependency>
<dependency> <artifactId>canova-api</artifactId> <groupId>org.nd4j</groupId> <version>0.0.0.14</version> </dependency> </denchmark-code>

This was fixed here (i.e., executor service threads are daemon threads). <denchmark-link:https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/commit/b85691d7c8ccbf60377d432e641753ed6a723238>deeplearning4j@b85691d</denchmark-link>
I'did make one minor change for 3.9 (to avoid creating 0-length INDArrays: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/pull/1385>https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/pull/1385</denchmark-link> ), but otherwise I've confirmed that this isn't an issue on latest version.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
